<dashboard version="2" isDashboard="false" app="ess">
<definition><![CDATA[{
  "visualizations": {
    "viz_searches_over_time_by_type": {
      "type": "splunk.column",
      "description": "",
      "dataSources": {
        "primary": "ds_searches_over_time_by_type"
      },
      "eventHandlers": [{
        "type": "drilldown.declarativeHandler",
        "options": {
          "params": {
            "search": "| tstats summariesonly=false count from datamodel=Splunk_Audit.Search_Activity where \"Search_Activity.search_type\"= ( Search_Activity.info=granted OR ( Search_Activity.info=completed Search_Activity.search_type=subsearch ) ) $ds_input_tokens:result.search_type_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.srch_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.search_alias_dm$ by _time Search_Activity.search_type span=10m",
            "timerange": {
              "earliest": "$global_time.earliest$",
              "latest": "$global_time.latest$"
            }
          },
          "handlerName": "searchAuditingDrilldownHandler",
          "events": [
            "point.click",
            "legend.click"
          ],
          "newTab": true,
          "vizType": "column"
        }
      }],
      "options": {
        "yAxisAbbreviation": "off",
        "y2AxisAbbreviation": "off",
        "showRoundedY2AxisLabels": false,
        "legendTruncation": "ellipsisMiddle",
        "showY2MajorGridLines": true,
        "xAxisTitleText": "time",
        "yAxisTitleText": "count",
        "stackMode": "stacked"
      },
      "title": "Searches Over Time By Type"
    },
    "viz_searches_by_status": {
      "type": "splunk.table",
      "description": "",
      "dataSources": {
        "primary": "ds_searches_by_status"
      },
      "eventHandlers": [{
        "type": "drilldown.setToken",
        "options": {
            "tokenNamespace": "payload",
            "tokens": [{
              "token": "row.info.value",
              "key": "row.info.value"
            }]
        }},
        {
          "type": "drilldown.customUrl",
          "options": {
            "url": "/app/SplunkEnterpriseSecuritySuite/search?q=| from datamodel:Splunk_Audit.Search_Activity | search info=\"$payload:row.info.value|u$\"&earliest=$global_time.earliest|u$&latest=$global_time.latest|u$&auto_pause=$ds_input_tokens:result.auto_pause|u$",
            "newTab": true
        }}
      ],
      "options": {},
      "title": "Searches By Status"
    },
    "viz_searches_by_user": {
      "type": "splunk.bar",
      "description": "",
      "dataSources": {
        "primary": "ds_searches_by_user"
      },
      "eventHandlers": [{
        "type": "drilldown.setToken",
        "options": {
            "tokenNamespace": "payload",
            "tokens": [{
              "token": "row.user.value",
              "key": "row.user.value"
            }]
        }},
        {
          "type": "drilldown.customUrl",
          "options": {
            "url": "/app/SplunkEnterpriseSecuritySuite/search?q=| from datamodel:Splunk_Audit.Search_Activity | search user=\"$payload:row.user.value|u$\"&earliest=$global_time.earliest|u$&latest=$global_time.latest|u$&auto_pause=$ds_input_tokens:result.auto_pause|u$",
            "newTab": true
        }}
      ],
      "options": {
        "yAxisAbbreviation": "off",
        "y2AxisAbbreviation": "off",
        "showRoundedY2AxisLabels": false,
        "legendTruncation": "ellipsisMiddle",
        "showY2MajorGridLines": true,
        "xAxisTitleText": "user",
        "yAxisTitleText": "count",
        "legendDisplay": "off"
      },
      "title": "Searches By User"
    },
    "viz_top_searches_by_run_time": {
      "type": "splunk.table",
      "description": "",
      "dataSources": {
        "primary": "ds_top_searches_by_run_time"
      },
      "eventHandlers": [{
        "type": "drilldown.setToken",
        "options": {
            "tokenNamespace": "payload",
            "tokens": [{
              "token": "row.search.value",
              "key": "row.search.value"
            }]
        }},
        {
          "type": "drilldown.customUrl",
          "options": {
            "url": "/app/SplunkEnterpriseSecuritySuite/search?q=| from datamodel:Splunk_Audit.Search_Activity | search search=\"$payload:row.search.value|u$\"&earliest=$global_time.earliest|u$&latest=$global_time.latest|u$&auto_pause=$ds_input_tokens:result.auto_pause|u$",
            "newTab": true
        }}
      ],
      "options": {},
      "title": "Top Searches By Run Time"
    }
  },
  "dataSources": {
    "ds_searches_over_time_by_type": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Searches Over Time By Type",
      "options": {
        "query": "| tstats `summariesonly` prestats=true count from datamodel=Splunk_Audit.Search_Activity where (Search_Activity.info=\"granted\" OR (Search_Activity.info=\"completed\" Search_Activity.search_type=\"subsearch\")) $ds_input_tokens:result.search_type_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.srch_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.search_alias_dm$ by _time,Search_Activity.search_type span=10m | timechart minspan=10m count by Search_Activity.search_type"
      }
    },
    "ds_searches_by_status": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Searches By Status",
      "options": {
        "query": "| tstats `summariesonly` count from datamodel=Splunk_Audit.Search_Activity where (Search_Activity.info=\"granted\" OR (Search_Activity.info=\"completed\" Search_Activity.search_type=\"subsearch\")) $ds_input_tokens:result.search_type_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.srch_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.search_alias_dm$ by Search_Activity.info | rename Search_Activity.* as * | sort 100 - count"
      }
    },
    "ds_searches_by_user": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Searches By User",
      "options": {
        "query": "| tstats `summariesonly` count from datamodel=Splunk_Audit.Search_Activity where (Search_Activity.info=\"granted\" OR (Search_Activity.info=\"completed\" Search_Activity.search_type=\"subsearch\")) $ds_input_tokens:result.search_type_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.srch_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.search_alias_dm$ by Search_Activity.user | rename Search_Activity.* as * | sort 10 - count"
      }
    },
    "ds_top_searches_by_run_time": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Top Searches By Run Time",
      "options": {
        "query": "| tstats `summariesonly` first(Search_Activity.search_alias) as search_alias,first(Search_Activity.search) as search,first(Search_Activity.total_run_time) as run_time,first(Search_Activity.user) as user from datamodel=Splunk_Audit.Search_Activity where * $ds_input_tokens:result.search_type_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.srch_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.search_alias_dm$ by Search_Activity.search_id | stats first(search_alias) as \"search alias\",min(run_time),avg(run_time),max(run_time),values(user) as user,count by search | eval \"min(run_time)\"=round('min(run_time)', 1),\"avg(run_time)\"=round('avg(run_time)', 1),\"max(run_time)\"=round('max(run_time)', 1) | sort 500 - \"avg(run_time)\""
      }
    },
    "ds_input_tokens": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "ds_input_tokens",
      "options": {
        "query": "| makeresults count=1\n| eval search_type_dm=if($search_type|s$==\"*\" OR $search_type|s$==\"\", \" \", \"Search_Activity.search_type=\\\"$search_type$\\\"\")\n| eval srch_dm=if($srch|s$==\"*\" OR $srch|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(Search_Activity.search=\\\"\".replace($srch|s$,\"\\\"\", \"\\\\\\\"\").\"\\\")\")\n| eval search_alias_dm=if($search_alias|s$==\"*\" OR $search_alias|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(Search_Activity.search_alias=\\\"$search_alias$\\\")\")\n| appendcols [|rest splunk_server=local count=0 /servicesNS/nobody/SplunkEnterpriseSecuritySuite/admin/macros/autopause | fields definition]\n| eval auto_pause=if(definition>0, definition, 0)",
        "enableSmartSources": true,
        "queryParameters": {
          "earliest": "0",
          "latest": "now"
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "defaults": {
    "visualizations": {
      "global": {
        "showProgressBar": true
      }
    },
    "dataSources": {
      "ds.search": {
        "options": {
          "queryParameters": {
            "latest": "$global_time.latest$",
            "earliest": "$global_time.earliest$"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "inputs": {
    "input_search_type": {
      "type": "input.dropdown",
      "title": "Search Type",
      "options": {
        "token": "search_type",
        "defaultValue": "*",
        "items": [{
          "value": "*",
          "label": "All"
        },{
          "value": "adhoc",
          "label": "Ad hoc"
        },{
          "value": "dm_acceleration",
          "label": "Data Model Acceleration"
        },{
          "value": "realtime",
          "label": "Real Time"
        },{
          "value": "scheduled",
          "label": "Scheduled"
        },{
          "value": "subsearch",
          "label": "Subsearch"
        },{
          "value": "summary_director",
          "label": "Summary Director"
        }]
      }
    },
    "input_srch": {
      "type": "input.text",
      "title": "Search",
      "options": {
        "token": "srch",
        "defaultValue": "*"
      }
    },
    "input_search_alias": {
      "type": "input.text",
      "title": "Search Alias",
      "options": {
        "token": "search_alias",
        "defaultValue": "*"
      }
    },
    "input_global_time": {
      "type": "input.timerange",
      "title": "Time Range",
      "options": {
        "token": "global_time",
        "defaultValue": "-24h@h,now"
      }
    }
  },
  "layout": {
    "type": "grid",
    "options": {},
    "structure": [{
      "item": "viz_searches_over_time_by_type",
      "type": "block",
      "position": {
        "x": 0,
        "y": 0,
        "w": 1200,
        "h": 250
      }
    },{
      "item": "viz_searches_by_status",
      "type": "block",
      "position": {
        "x": 0,
        "y": 250,
        "w": 600,
        "h": 315
      }
    },{
      "item": "viz_searches_by_user",
      "type": "block",
      "position": {
        "x": 600,
        "y": 250,
        "w": 600,
        "h": 315
      }
    },{
      "item": "viz_top_searches_by_run_time",
      "type": "block",
      "position": {
        "x": 0,
        "y": 565,
        "w": 1200,
        "h": 800
      }
    }],
    "globalInputs": [
      "input_search_type",
      "input_srch",
      "input_search_alias",
      "input_global_time"
    ]
  },
  "description": "",
  "title": "Search Audit"
}]]></definition>

result.eai:data:
false | `dmc_get_groups_containing_role(dmc_group_search_head)` | search search_group="dmc_customgroup_*" OR search_group="dmc_indexerclustergroup_*" OR search_group="dmc_searchheadclustergroup_*" label search_group All Search Heads * Last 4 hours search_type="ad hoc" Yes No AND
`dmc_audit_get_searches_for_groups("$group$")` | stats min(_time) as _time, values(user) as user, max(total_run_time) as total_run_time, first(search) as search, first(search_type) as search_type, first(apiStartTime) as apiStartTime, first(apiEndTime) as apiEndTime by search_id, host | where isnotnull(search) $filter_out_non_adhoc$ $time.earliest$ $time.latest$ stats dc(user) as user_count $result.user_count$ $result.user_count$ stats dc(host) as search_head_count $result.search_head_count$ $result.search_head_count$ Search Activity by User ($user_count$) stats dc(host) as count_host, median(total_run_time) as median_runtime, sum(total_run_time) as cum_runtime, count(search) as count, max(_time) as last_use by user | eval median_runtime = if(isnotnull(median_runtime), median_runtime, "-") | eval cum_runtime = if(isnotnull(cum_runtime), cum_runtime, "-") | `dmc_time_format(last_use)` | fields user, count, count_host, median_runtime, cum_runtime, last_use | sort - count | rename user as User, count_host as "Search Head Count", count as "Search Count", median_runtime as "Median Runtime", cum_runtime as "Cumulative Runtime", last_use as "Last Search" | fieldformat "Median Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Median Runtime')` | fieldformat "Cumulative Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Cumulative Runtime')` $row.User$ $row.User$

Click to see a list of search head names and a list of search strings.

 Search Heads Used by $user_drilldown_hosts$ search user=$user_drilldown_hosts$ | stats count(search) as count by host | sort - count | fields host, count | rename host as "Search Head", count as "Search Count"
Close this panel Searches by $user_drilldown_searches$ search user=$user_drilldown_searches$ | stats count by search | sort - count | fields count, search | rename search as "Report Name/Search String", count as "Count"
Close this panel Search Activity by Search Head ($search_head_count$) stats median(total_run_time) as median_runtime sum(total_run_time) as cum_runtime count(search) as count_search max(_time) as last_use dc(user) as count_user by host | eval median_runtime = if(isnotnull(median_runtime), median_runtime, "-") | eval cum_runtime = if(isnotnull(cum_runtime), cum_runtime, "-") | `dmc_time_format(last_use)` | fields host, count_search, count_user, median_runtime, cum_runtime, last_use | sort - count_search | rename host as "Search Head", count_search as "Search Count", count_user as "User Count", median_runtime as "Median Runtime", cum_runtime as "Cumulative Runtime", last_use as "Last Search" | fieldformat "Median Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Median Runtime')` | fieldformat "Cumulative Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Cumulative Runtime')` $row.Search Head$ $row.Search Head$

Click to see a list of users and a list of search strings.

 Users on $host_drilldown_users$ search host=$host_drilldown_users|s$ | stats count(search) as count by user | sort - count | fields user, count | rename user as "User", count as "Count"
Close this panel Searches on $host_drilldown_searches$ search host=$host_drilldown_searches|s$ | stats count by search | sort - count | fields count, search | rename search as "Report Name/Search String", count as "Count"
Close this panel Frequently Run Searches search user="*" | stats count(search) as count, median(total_run_time) as median_runtime, max(total_run_time) as max_runtime, values(user) as user, values(host) as host, values(search_type) as search_type by search | eval median_runtime = if(isnotnull(median_runtime), median_runtime, "-") | eval max_runtime = if(isnotnull(max_runtime), max_runtime, "-") | sort - count | rename search as "Report Name/Search String", count as "Count", median_runtime as "Median Runtime", max_runtime as "Max Runtime", user as Users, host as Hosts, search_type as Type | fieldformat "Median Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Median Runtime')` | fieldformat "Max Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Max Runtime')`
Long-running Searches search user="*" search="*" | eval earliest = case(like(apiStartTime, "%ZERO_TIME%") AND like(apiEndTime, "%ZERO_TIME%"), "all time", like(apiStartTime, "%ZERO_TIME%"), "-", 1 == 1, apiStartTime ) | eval latest = case(like(apiStartTime, "%ZERO_TIME%") AND like(apiEndTime, "%ZERO_TIME%"), "all time", like(apiEndTime, "%ZERO_TIME%"), "-", 1 == 1, apiEndTime ) | `dmc_time_format(_time)` | stats max(total_run_time) as total_run_time by search, _time, earliest, latest, search_type, user, host, search_id | sort - total_run_time | eval total_run_time = if(isnotnull(total_run_time), total_run_time, "-") | fields search, total_run_time, _time, earliest, latest, search_type, user, host, search_id | rename search as "Report Name/Search String", total_run_time as "Search Runtime", _time as "Search Start", earliest as "Earliest Time", latest as "Latest Time", search_type as Type, user as "User", host as "Host", search_id as SID | fieldformat "Search Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Search Runtime')` $row.SID$

Click to see detail

Detail of SID: $long_running_sid$ where search_id=$long_running_sid|s$ Close event view

result.label: Search Usage Statistics: Instance
result.title: search_usage_statistics_instance
result.eai:data:
false | `dmc_get_groups_containing_role(dmc_group_search_head)` | search search_group!="dmc_group_*" label search_group All Search Heads dmc_group_search_head false | `dmc_get_instance_info($dmc_group$)` | where search_group="dmc_group_search_head" true $row.host$ Last 4 hours search_type="ad hoc" Yes No AND
`dmc_audit_get_searches($host$)` | stats min(_time) as _time, values(user) as user, max(total_run_time) as total_run_time, first(search) as search, first(search_type) as search_type, first(apiStartTime) as apiStartTime, first(apiEndTime) as apiEndTime by search_id | where isnotnull(search) $filter_out_non_adhoc$ $time.earliest$ $time.latest$ stats dc(user) as user_count $result.user_count$ $result.user_count$ Search Activity by User ($user_count$) | stats median(total_run_time) as median_runtime Perc90(total_run_time) as Perc90_runtime sum(total_run_time) as cum_runtime count(search) as count max(_time) as last_use by user | eval last_use = strftime(last_use, "%F %T") | fields user, count, median_runtime, Perc90_runtime, cum_runtime, last_use | rename user as User, count as "Search Count", median_runtime as "Median Runtime", Perc90_runtime as "90th Percentile Runtime", cum_runtime as "Cumulative Runtime", last_use as "Last Search" | fieldformat "Median Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Median Runtime')` | fieldformat "90th Percentile Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('90th Percentile Runtime')` | fieldformat "Cumulative Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Cumulative Runtime')`
Frequently Run Searches All `dmc_audit_get_searches($host$)` | stats count by user $time.earliest$ $time.latest$ user user * search user=" " false $common_search_user_filter$ | stats count median(total_run_time) as median_runtime max(total_run_time) as max_runtime values(user) as user by search | eval median_runtime=if(isnotnull(median_runtime), median_runtime, "-") | eval max_runtime=if(isnotnull(max_runtime), max_runtime, "-") | sort - count | rename search as "Search", count as "Count", median_runtime as "Median Runtime", max_runtime as "Max Runtime", user as User | fieldformat "Median Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Median Runtime')` | fieldformat "Max Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Max Runtime')`
Long-running Searches All `dmc_audit_get_searches($host$)` | stats count by user $time.earliest$ $time.latest$ user user * search user=" " false $long_running_search_user_filter$ | fields search, total_run_time, _time, apiStartTime, apiEndTime, search_type, user | eval earliest = case( like(apiStartTime, "%ZERO_TIME%") AND like(apiEndTime, "%ZERO_TIME%"), "all time", like(apiStartTime, "%ZERO_TIME%"), "-", 1 == 1, apiStartTime ) | eval latest = case( like(apiStartTime, "%ZERO_TIME%") AND like(apiEndTime, "%ZERO_TIME%"), "all time", like(apiEndTime, "%ZERO_TIME%"), "-", 1 == 1, apiEndTime ) | eval search = if(isnotnull(search), search, "N/A") | `dmc_time_format(_time)` | sort - total_run_time | fields search, total_run_time, _time, earliest, latest, search_type, user | rename search as Search, total_run_time as "Search Runtime", _time as "Search Start", earliest as "Earliest Time", latest as "Latest Time", search_type as Type, user as "User" | fieldformat "Search Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Search Runtime')` $time.earliest$$time.latest$
Common Search Commands eval commands = commands(search) | streamstats window=1 values(commands) as commands | stats count avg(total_run_time) as avg_runtime max(total_run_time) as max_runtime by commands | eval avg_runtime = round(avg_runtime, 2) | eval max_runtime = round(max_runtime, 2) | sort - count, - max_runtime, - avg_runtime | rename commands as Command, avg_runtime as "Average Runtime", max_runtime as "Max Runtime", count as "Count" | eval "Average Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Average Runtime')` | eval "Max Runtime" = `dmc_convert_runtime('Max Runtime')` $time.earliest$$time.latest$

result.label: Secure Gateway Status Dashboard
result.title: secure_gateway_status_dashboard
result.eai:data:
mobile,tv
-60m@m now
Secure Gateway Status index="_internal" source="*secure_gateway*" aiohttp_wss_protocol "Received Pong" | head 1 | stats count as pong_count | eval spacebridge_up = if(pong_count > 0, "Connected", "Not Connected") | eval range=if(pong_count > 0, "low", "severe") | table spacebridge_up, range -2m now 1m delay 1 KV Store Status | rest services/kvstore/status | search current.disabled = 0 | fields current.status | eval upper=upper('current.status') | eval range=if(upper="READY", "low", "severe") | table upper range -1m now 1m delay

Secure Gateway Reachability

 Websocket | noop | checkssgmobilewss | eval ok = if(websocket > 0, "OK", "Failed") | eval range=if(websocket > 0, "low", "severe") | table ok, range -1s now 1m delay HTTPS (Sync) | noop | checkssgmobilehttps | eval ok = if(https_sync > 0, "OK", "Failed") | eval range=if(https_sync > 0, "low", "severe") | table ok, range -1s now 1m delay HTTPS (Async) | noop | checkssgmobileasync | eval ok = if(https_async > 0, "OK", "Failed") | eval range=if(https_async > 0, "low", "severe") | table ok, range -1s now 1m delay Messages Received and Sent by Secure Gateway index="_internal" source="*secure_gateway*" message="RECEIVED_ENVELOPE" OR message="SENT_BACK" | bin span=2min _time | timechart span=2m count by message $field1.earliest$ $field1.latest$ 1 1m delay Average Request Latency By Type index="_internal" sourcetype="secure_gateway_app_internal_log" message_processor process_request_list OR process_message NOT ERROR | transaction request_id startswith="process_request_list" endswith="Finished processing" | stats count(duration), avg(duration) by type | rename avg(duration) as latency | rename count(duration) as count | table type, count, latency $field1.earliest$ $field1.latest$ 1 1m delay
Error Count By Module Name index="_internal" sourcetype="secure_gateway_app_internal_log" log_level=ERROR | bin span=2min _time | timechart span=2m count by app_name $field1.earliest$ $field1.latest$ 1 1m delay Websocket Disconnections Count index="_internal" source="*secure_gateway*" protocol "Websocket connection was closed" | bin span=1h _time | timechart span=1h count $field1.earliest$ $field1.latest$ 1 1m delay Most Recent Error Messages index="_internal" sourcetype="secure_gateway_app_internal_log" log_level=ERROR | head 10 $field1.earliest$ $field1.latest$ 1m delay

result.eai:data:
<dashboard version="2" isDashboard="false" app="ess">
<definition><![CDATA[{
  "visualizations": {

      },

          "left"
        ]
      },
      "options": {
        "headerVisibility": "fixed",
        "tableFormat": {
          "align": "> table | pick(alignLeft)"
        },
        "columnFormat": {
          "requestParameters": {
            "width": 120,
            "textOverflow": "ellipsis"
          },
          "result": {
            "width": 120,
            "textOverflow": "ellipsis"
          }
        }
      },

    }
  },
  "dataSources": {
    "ds_regions": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Regions",
      "options": {
        "query": "| inputlookup aws_regions",
        "queryParameters": {
          "earliest": "-1s",
          "latest": "now"
        }
      }
    },
    "ds_account_id": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Account",
      "options": {
        "query": "| inputlookup aws_all_account_ids | search account_id!=\"ANONYMOUS_PRINCIPAL\"",
        "queryParameters": {
          "earliest": "-1s",
          "latest": "now"
        }
      }
    },
    "ds_error_events": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Error Events",
      "options": {
        "data": {
          "rawQuery": "| datamodel `summariesonly` Change Network_Changes search  | search All_Changes.command=\"*securityGroup*\" | `drop_dm_object_name(\"All_Changes\")` | search $ds_input_tokens:result.accountID_DM$ $ds_input_tokens:result.regions_DM$ status=failure | head 100 | stats count"
        },
        "query": "| tstats `summariesonly` count as result FROM datamodel=Change.All_Changes WHERE nodename=All_Changes.Network_Changes All_Changes.command=\"*securityGroup*\" $ds_input_tokens:result.accountID_TSTATS$ $ds_input_tokens:result.regions_TSTATS$ All_Changes.status=failure | `drop_dm_object_name(\"All_Changes\")`"
      }
    },
    "ds_security_group_actions": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Security Group Action",
      "options": {
        "data": {
          "rawQuery": "| datamodel `summariesonly` Change Network_Changes search  | search All_Changes.command=\"*securityGroup*\" | `drop_dm_object_name(\"All_Changes\")` | search $ds_input_tokens:result.accountID_DM$ $ds_input_tokens:result.regions_DM$ $ds_input_tokens:result.status_DM$ | head 100 | stats count by command | sort 100 - count"
        },
        "query": "| tstats `summariesonly` count as result FROM datamodel=Change.All_Changes WHERE nodename=All_Changes.Network_Changes All_Changes.command=\"*securityGroup*\" $ds_input_tokens:result.accountID_TSTATS$ $ds_input_tokens:result.regions_TSTATS$ $ds_input_tokens:result.status_TSTATS$ by All_Changes.command | `drop_dm_object_name(\"All_Changes\")` | sort 100 - result"
      }
    },
    "ds_security_group_activity": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Security Group Activity",
      "options": {
        "data": {
          "rawQuery": "| datamodel `summariesonly` Change Network_Changes search  | search All_Changes.command=\"*securityGroup*\" | `drop_dm_object_name(\"All_Changes\")` | search $ds_input_tokens:result.accountID_DM$ $ds_input_tokens:result.regions_DM$ $ds_input_tokens:result.status_DM$ | head 100 | stats count as result by _time, command | timechart limit=20 sum(result) BY command span=1d | fillnull value=0"
        },
        "query": "| tstats `summariesonly` count as result FROM datamodel=Change.All_Changes WHERE nodename=All_Changes.Network_Changes All_Changes.command=\"*securityGroup*\" $ds_input_tokens:result.accountID_TSTATS$ $ds_input_tokens:result.regions_TSTATS$ $ds_input_tokens:result.status_TSTATS$ by _time, All_Changes.command | `drop_dm_object_name(\"All_Changes\")` | timechart limit=20 sum(result) BY command | fillnull value=0"
      }
    },
    "ds_most_recent_security_group_activity": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Most Recent Security Group Activity",
      "options": {
        "data": {},
        "query": "| datamodel `summariesonly` Change Network_Changes search  | search All_Changes.command=\"*securityGroup*\" | `drop_dm_object_name(\"All_Changes\")` | search $ds_input_tokens:result.accountID_DM$ $ds_input_tokens:result.regions_DM$ $ds_input_tokens:result.status_DM$ | head 100 | spath userIdentity.arn output=arn | table command, user, user_name, arn, src, object_id, vendor_account, vendor_region, _time"
      }
    },
    "ds_most_recent_authorize_and_revoke_activity": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Auth Revoke Activity",
      "options": {
        "data": {},
        "query": "| datamodel `summariesonly` Change Network_Changes search  | search All_Changes.command=\"*securityGroup*\" | `drop_dm_object_name(\"All_Changes\")` | search $ds_input_tokens:result.accountID_DM$ $ds_input_tokens:result.regions_DM$ $ds_input_tokens:result.status_DM$ (command=\"RevokeSecurityGroup*\" OR command=\"AuthorizeSecurityGroup*\") dvc=ec2* | head 100\n            | spath | rename \"requestParameters.ipPermissions.items{}.ipProtocol\" AS protocol, \"requestParameters.ipPermissions.items{}.fromPort\" as fromPort, \"requestParameters.ipPermissions.items{}.toPort\" AS toPort, userIdentity.arn AS arn, responseElements._return AS return\n            | mvexpand protocol\n            | eval protocol=if((protocol == -1),\"ALL\",protocol)\n            | eval port_range=mvzip(fromPort,toPort,\"-\")\n            | eval direction=case(match(command,\".*Ingress\"),\"ingress\",match(command,\".*Egress\"),\"egress\")\n            | table command, arn, user, user_name, src, protocol, port_range, direction, object_id, vendor_account, vendor_region, return, _time"
      }
    },
    "ds_security_group_error_activity": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Security Group Error Activity",
      "options": {
        "data": {},
        "query": "| datamodel `summariesonly` Change Network_Changes search  | search All_Changes.command=\"*securityGroup*\" | `drop_dm_object_name(\"All_Changes\")` | search $ds_input_tokens:result.accountID_DM$ $ds_input_tokens:result.regions_DM$ status=failure | head 100 | spath requestParameters | table command, user, user_name, src, object_id, result_id, result, requestParameters, vendor_account, vendor_region, _time"
      }
    },
    "ds_input_tokens": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "ds_input_tokens",
      "options": {
        "enableSmartSources": true,
        "query": "| makeresults count=1\n| eval region=\"$region$\"\n| eval list=split(region,\",\")\n| eval filterlist=mvfilter(!list IN (\"*\"))\n| eval regions_fields_dm=\"(\".mvjoin(mvmap(filterlist,\"vendor_region=\\\"\" . filterlist . \"\\\"\"), \" OR \").\")\"\n| eval regions_fields_tstats=\"(\".mvjoin(mvmap(filterlist,\"All_Changes.vendor_region=\\\"\" . filterlist . \"\\\"\"), \" OR \").\")\"\n| eval regions_fields=\"(\".mvjoin(mvmap(filterlist,\"region=\\\"\" . filterlist . \"\\\"\"), \" OR \").\")\"\n| eval regions=case(region==\"*\",\"(region=\\\"*\\\")\", true(), regions_fields)\n| eval regions_DM=case(region==\"*\",\"(vendor_region=\\\"*\\\")\", true(), regions_fields_dm)\n| eval regions_TSTATS=case(region==\"*\",\"(All_Changes.vendor_region=\\\"*\\\")\", true(), regions_fields_tstats)\n| eval status_DM=\"(status=\\\"$status$\\\")\"\n| eval status_TSTATS=\"(All_Changes.status=\\\"$status$\\\")\"\n\n| eval accountID_temp=\"$account_id$\"\n| eval list=split(accountID_temp,\",\")\n| eval filterlist=mvfilter(!list IN (\"*\"))\n| eval accountID_fields_dm=\"(\".mvjoin(mvmap(filterlist,\"vendor_account=\\\"\" . filterlist . \"\\\"\"), \" OR \").\")\"\n| eval accountID_fields_tstats=\"(\".mvjoin(mvmap(filterlist,\"All_Changes.vendor_account=\\\"\" . filterlist . \"\\\"\"), \" OR \").\")\"\n| eval accountID_fields=\"(\".mvjoin(mvmap(filterlist,\"accountID_temp=\\\"\" . filterlist . \"\\\"\"), \" OR \").\")\"\n| eval accountID=case(accountID_temp==\"*\",\"(accountID_temp=\\\"*\\\")\", true(), accountID_fields)\n| eval accountID_DM=case(accountID_temp==\"*\",\"(vendor_account=\\\"*\\\")\", true(), accountID_fields_dm)\n| eval accountID_TSTATS=case(accountID_temp==\"*\",\"(All_Changes.vendor_account=\\\"*\\\")\", true(), accountID_fields_tstats)",
        "queryParameters": {
          "earliest": "0",
          "latest": "now"
        }
      }
    }
  },

Historical Charts -4h@m now Scheduler Activity fields - delegated_waiting delegated_scheduled max_pending max_running

dispatched: The number of scheduled search jobs that the captain successfully dispatched to members.

skipped: The number of jobs that were skipped and not dispatched.

delegated: The number of jobs that the captain attempted to dispatch. This is usually the same as the number of dispatched jobs.

 Scheduler Status false Max Average Median Minimum Maximum 90th Percentile Sampled $label$ fields - dispatched skipped delegated

delegated_waiting: The number of jobs currently running on members.

delegated_scheduled: The number of jobs that the captain is trying to contact members to start running. This is usually 0, unless the captain or network is backed up.

max_pending: The number of jobs pending over a 30 second period.

result.label: Detect New Values
result.title: showcase_first_seen_demo
result.description: Find new values (hosts, processes, etc.).
result.eai:data:
Find new values (hosts, processes, etc.).

How Does This Detection Work

This method of anomaly detection tracks the earliest and latest time for any arbitrary set of values (such as the first logon per user + server combination, or first view per code repository + user combination, or first windows event ID indicating a USB Key usage per system). With normal usage, you'd check to see if the latest value is within the last 24 hours and alert if that's the case (with our demo data, rather than comparing to right now() we compare to the largest value of latest()). This is a major feature of many Security Data Science tools on the market (though not Splunk UBA) that you can get easily with Splunk Enterprise.

  • Detect New Values

(required for demo dataset)

Raw Data Preview

(Review settings and click Detect above to find outliers.)

result.label: Detect Spikes
result.title: showcase_standard_deviation
result.description: Find values that differ significantly from previous values.
result.eai:data:
Find values that differ significantly from previous values.

How Does This Detection Work?

This method of anomaly detection builds an individual per-entity baseline by using daily values and then creating an average and a standard deviation. If the most recent value is more than X standard deviations away from the average, then it's anomalous. This is the cornerstone of many of the Security Data Science tools on the market (though not Splunk UBA) that you can get easily with Splunk Enterprise.

What Is Standard Deviation?

Standard deviation (aka stdev() in Splunk) is a measure of the variance for a series of numbers. For example:

  • One file is opened on 100, 123, 79, and 145 hosts per day
    • Average of 111.75 and a standard deviation of 28.53
  • Another file is opened on 100, 342, 3 and 2 hosts per day
    • Average of 111.75, but a standard deviation of 160.23
  • If on the final day, both files are opened on 500 hosts, the second file will only be 2.42 standard deviations away from normal (the average), but the first file will be 13.6 standard deviations away. WAY more deviation!

How Much Deviation Is Too Much?

  • The number of stdevs away from the average (in the example just discussed, 13.6 or 2.42), also known as the z-score, is how you describe how much variation you're willing to tolerate.
  • If your data set looked like a perfect bell curve (remember those?), one (1) stdev away from the average would encompass 68% of the data points, two (2) stdev would cover 95% of the data points, and three (3) stdev would cover 99.7%
  • Your data probably doesn't look like a perfect bell curve, but in practice it's just as easy to filter for four (4) stdev, or five (5), or six (6) and isolate any noise in your data. So play with the numbers and see how they look.
  • Detect Spikes

(required for demo dataset)

Raw Data Preview

(Review settings and click Detect above to find outliers.)

Remote Storage Connectivity `dmc_set_index_internal` search_group=$search_group$ source=*splunkd.log CacheManager action=* earliest=-1h | stats count(eval(status="failed")) as txn_failed, count(eval(status="succeeded")) as txn_succeeded | eval available=case(txn_failed=0 AND txn_succeeded=0, "IDLE", txn_succeeded>0, "ONLINE", true(), "OFFLINE") | fields - txn_failed - txn_succeeded

IDLE means no remote activity has happened in the last hour.

Otherwise ignore this. Bootstrapping progress `dmc_set_index_internal` search_group=$search_group$ group=cmmaster source=*metrics.log subgroup=buckets_re_creation | stats sum(success_count) as successes, sum(in_progress_count) as in_progress | eval total = successes + in_progress | eval percent = if(total=0, 100, (1 - ((in_progress - successes) / total)) * 100) | fields percent $range.earliest$ $range.latest$ This tracks progress when bootstrapping data from remote storage onto indexers. Otherwise, ignore this. Cache Thrash by Index .*)~.*~.*\|" | eval identifier=(cache_id + host) | stats count by identifier, customer_index | stats count(eval(count>1)) as duplicate_downloads, sum(count) as all_downloads count(eval(count>=10)) as excessive_duplicate_downloads by customer_index | eval duplicate_percent=if(all_downloads=0, 0, round((duplicate_downloads/all_downloads)*100, 2)) | sort - duplicate_percent | fields customer_index, duplicate_percent all_downloads duplicate_downloads excessive_duplicate_downloads | rename customer_index as Index, duplicate_percent as "Repeat Download Percent", all_downloads as "All Downloads", duplicate_downloads as "Repeated Downloads", excessive_duplicate_downloads as "Excessively Repeated Downloads" ]]> -24h@h now
This is the percentage of bucket downloads that are repeats. This happens when a bucket is downloaded for a search, evicted based on policy, and then needed by a search again. "Excessively Repeated Downloads" are buckets that have been downloaded more than 10 times.

result.label: CIM Compliance Check
result.title: sse_cim_compliance
result.eai:data:
| inputlookup data_inventory_products_lookup | search stage="all-done" 1 1 1 1 Introduction

Welcome to the Common Information Model Compliance Check dashboard. This dashboard builds on top of the Data Inventory introspection to show you what fields are CIM compliant. It aggregates those fields per-product, and tells you how those products are doing. CIM compliance is performed by checking common field values against a regular expression, also shown. Important note: this looks for the most common CIM fields used for most security content, but doesn't check all CIM fields.

If you're new to Splunk's Common Information Model, consider reading Splunk Docs. If you would like to go deeper into assessing the CIM compliance of your data, we highly recommend SA-cim_vladiator -- this functionality is a simplified version of what Splunk's Vladimir Skoryk has built there.

 Data Inventory Not Configured

It appears that no data inventory are fully configured. Configure Data Inventory first and then return to this dashboard.

" and events=" . num_events | append [| inputlookup SSE-data_availability_latency_status.csv | where baseline_num_data_samples > 100 AND baseline_avg_lag < 4*3600] | stats sum(num_events) as num_events values(eventcount) as eventcount min(latest_indextime) as slowest_max_indextime_for_any_index_sourcetype min(max_time) as slowest_max_time_for_any_index_sourcetype max(latest_indextime) as latest_indextime max(max_time) as max_time values(termsearch) as termsearch by productId | lookup SSE-data_availability_latency_status.csv productId | lookup data_inventory_products_lookup productId OUTPUT productName vendorName termsearch | eval lag = now() - max_time, max_lag = lag | apply app:sse_event_lag_model upper_threshold=0.01 show_density=true | rename "IsOutlier(lag)" as max_isOutlier "ProbabilityDensity(lag)" as max_probability | eval lag = now() - slowest_max_time_for_any_index_sourcetype, slowest_lag = lag | apply app:sse_event_lag_model upper_threshold=0.01 show_density=true | rename "IsOutlier(lag)" as slowest_isOutlier "ProbabilityDensity(lag)" as slowest_probability | eval num_events=coalesce(num_events, 0), vendorName=if(isnull(vendorName) OR vendorName="" OR vendorName=" ", "Unknown", vendorName), productName=if(isnull(productName) OR productName="", productId, productName) | eval color=case(isnull(max_time), "#F2D7D5", isnull(slowest_isOutlier),"#F2F3F4", slowest_isOutlier=1 AND max_isOutlier=1, "#FAE5D3", slowest_isOutlier=1, "#FCF3CF", 1=1, "#D1F2EB") | eval sortby=case(isnull(max_time), 0, isnull(slowest_isOutlier),4, slowest_isOutlier=1 AND max_isOutlier=1, 1, slowest_isOutlier=1, 2, 1=1, 10) | eval Summary=case(isnull(max_time), "No data has been seen in the past four days", isnull(slowest_isOutlier),"We don't have an established baseline for this product", slowest_isOutlier=1 AND max_isOutlier=1, "The latency observed is outside normal ranges", slowest_isOutlier=1, "While some data is on time, some of the sourcetypes have unusually high latency.", 1=1, "No issues.") | join type=outer productId [| sseanalytics | search enabled=Yes | stats count as numDetections values(search_title) as dependent_searches by productId | eval dependent_searches = mvjoin(dependent_searches, "|")] | eval numDetections = coalesce(numDetections, 0), max_lag=coalesce(max_lag, "> Timerange") | eval eventcount = coalesce(eventcount, termsearch . ", no events") | table * -4h@h now 1 1 0 0 Loading Data... Model Health Warning
MLTK Warning | makeresults |eval Summary="This dashboard (and the underlying models) requires the usage of Splunk's Machine Learning Toolkit version 4.1 or beyond. Please make sure that you have a suitable version installed, along with the Python for Scientific Computing Add-on that MLTK uses." | table Summary
| makeresults | eval title="Apps Present:", version="" | fields - title | append[| rest /services/apps/local | table title version | search title=Splunk_ML_Toolkit OR title=Splunk_SA_Scientific_Python*]
 Model Not Built Run Baseline Search Data Latency by Product

This dashboard pulls a dataset from the configuration in the Data Inventory dashboard. A nightly search will run and over the past thirty days to determine how much latency is expected from each configured product. That data is pushed into a Machine Learning model and statistics are recorded. This dashboard then grabs data from the past four hours, calculates the current data lag, and feeds that through the ML model to determine if it is normal or not.

| sort sortby | fields - sortby | eval slowest_lag = if(slowest_lag=max_lag, "", slowest_lag) | table color productId vendorName productName eventcount Summary max_lag slowest_lag numDetections baseline* dependent_searches | rename max_lag as "Minimum Lag Seen Per Product" slowest_lag as "Maximum Lag Seen Per Product (if different)" vendorName as "Vendor" productName as Product num_events as "Number of Events in Last Four Hours" eventcount as "Index/Sourcetypes and Events" numDetections as "Number of Enabled Detections" ["Vendor","Product","Index/Sourcetypes and Events","Summary","Minimum Lag Seen Per Product","Maximum Lag Seen Per Product (if different)","Number of Enabled Detections", "color", "productId"]

result.label: End-to-End Websocket Test

result.description: Initiate a sample request to run an end-to-end websocket test for Splunk Secure Gateway, device authentication, and Spacebridge messaging. This dashboard requires JSON Web Tokens (JWT) to be enabled.
result.eai:data:
mobile,tv Initiate a sample request to run an end-to-end websocket test for Splunk Secure Gateway, device authentication, and Spacebridge messaging. This dashboard requires JSON Web Tokens (JWT) to be enabled. | rest "services/ssg/test_websocket" request_type=$request_type$ request_mode=$request_mode$ -15m now $result.wss_rid$
Single Request Subscription Message clientSingleRequest Version Get Request App List Request Minimal Dashboard List Alerts List Request Generic Message Request Dashboard List Request Client Subscribe Request "{\"versionGetRequest\": {}}"
Auth Code Validation | eval status=if(auth_code_status="200", "Success", if(auth_code_status="0", "Did not run", "Failure")) | eval range=if(status="Success", "low", "severe") | table status range Server Side Registration | eval status=if(server_registration_status="201", "Success", if(server_registration_status="0", "Did not run", "Failure")) | eval range=if(status="Success", "low", if(status="Failure", "severe", "guarded")) | table status range Websocket Test | eval status=if(wss_response="0", "Did Not Run", if(wss_response!="[]", "Success", "Failure")) | eval range=if(status="Success", "low", if(status="Failure", "severe", "guarded")) | table status range Error Message | table error | eval message=if(LEN(error) > 1, error, "N/A") | table message Websocket Response (Click on panel to get full trace of request) | table wss_response /app/splunk_secure_gateway/request_tracing_dashboard?requestId=$rid$

result.label: ssl_activity_data
result.title: ssl_activity_data
result.eai:data:
<dashboard version="2" isDashboard="false" app="ess">
<definition><![CDATA[{
  "visualizations": {
    "viz_keyIndicators": {
      "type": "custom.keyIndicators",
      "description": "",
      "dataSources": {},
      "eventHandlers": [],
      "options": {
          "groupName": "net_ssl_activity"
      }
    },
    "viz_ssl_activity_by_common_name": {
      "type": "splunk.pie",
      "description": "",
      "dataSources": {
        "primary": "ds_ssl_activity_by_common_name"
      },
      "eventHandlers": [{
        "type": "drilldown.setToken",
        "options": {
            "tokenNamespace": "payload",
            "tokens": [{
              "token": "row.ssl_subject_common_name.value",
              "key": "row.ssl_subject_common_name.value"
            }]
        }},
        {
          "type": "drilldown.customUrl",
          "options": {
            "url": "/app/SplunkEnterpriseSecuritySuite/ssl_search?form.cn=$payload:row.ssl_subject_common_name.value|u$&form.global_time.earliest=$global_time.earliest|u$&form.global_time.latest=$global_time.latest|u$",
            "newTab": true
        }}
      ],
      "options": {},
      "title": "SSL Activity By Common Name"
    },
    "viz_ssl_cloud_sessions": {
      "type": "splunk.bar",
      "description": "",
      "dataSources": {
        "primary": "ds_ssl_cloud_sessions"
      },
      "eventHandlers": [{
        "type": "drilldown.declarativeHandler",
        "options": {
          "params": {
            "timerange": {
              "earliest": "$global_time.earliest$",
              "latest": "$global_time.latest$"
            }
          },
          "handlerName": "sslActivityDrilldownHandler",
          "events": [
            "point.click",
            "legend.click"
          ],
          "newTab": true,
          "vizType": "bar"
        }
      }],
      "options": {
        "yAxisAbbreviation": "off",
        "y2AxisAbbreviation": "off",
        "showRoundedY2AxisLabels": false,
        "legendTruncation": "ellipsisMiddle",
        "showY2MajorGridLines": true,
        "stackMode": "stacked"
      },
      "title": "SSL Cloud Sessions"
    },
    "viz_recent_ssl_sessions_table": {
      "type": "splunk.table",
      "description": "",
      "dataSources": {
        "primary": "ds_recent_ssl_sessions_table"
      },
      "eventHandlers": [{
        "type": "drilldown.setToken",
        "options": {
            "tokenNamespace": "payload",
            "tokens": [{
              "token": "row.src.value",
              "key": "row.src.value"
            },
            {
              "token": "row.dest.value",
              "key": "row.dest.value"
            },
            {
              "token": "row.ssl_issuer_common_name.value",
              "key": "row.ssl_issuer_common_name.value"
            }]
        }},
        {
          "type": "drilldown.customUrl",
          "options": {
            "url": "/app/SplunkEnterpriseSecuritySuite/ssl_search?form.src=$payload:row.src.value|u$&form.dest=$payload:row.dest.value|u$&form.cn=$payload:row.ssl_issuer_common_name.value|u$&form.global_time.earliest=$global_time.earliest|u$&form.global_time.latest=$global_time.latest|u$",
            "newTab": true
        }}
      ],
      "options": {
        "count": 15,
        "drilldown": "row",
        "columnFormat": {
          "ssl_is_valid": {
            "rowColors": "> table | seriesByName('ssl_is_valid') | matchValue(valid_ssl_config_color, '#8A8A8A')"
          },
          "ssl_end_time": {
            "rowColors": "> table | seriesByName('_expiry') | matchValue(valid_ssl_config_color, '#8A8A8A')"
          },
          "ssl_validity_window": {
            "rowColors": "> table | seriesByName('_day') | matchValue(valid_ssl_config_color, '#8A8A8A')"
          }
        },
        "showInternalFields": false
      },
      "context": {
        "valid_ssl_config_color": [{
          "match": "Valid",
          "value": "#619628"
        },{
          "match": "Invalid",
          "value": "#C42323"
        },{
          "match": "expired",
          "value": "#C42323"
        },{
          "match": "soon",
          "value": "#F88509"
        },{
          "match": "extended",
          "value": "#619628"
        },{
          "match": "(< 30 days)",
          "value": "#C42323"
        },{
          "match": "(< 90 days)",
          "value": "#F88509"
        },{
          "match": "day",
          "value": "themes.defaultFontColor"
        }]
      },
      "title": "Recent SSL Sessions"
    }
  },
  "dataSources": {
    "ds_ssl_activity_by_common_name": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "SSL Activity By Common Name",
      "options": {
        "query": "| tstats `summariesonly` count from datamodel=Certificates.All_Certificates where nodename=All_Certificates.SSL by All_Certificates.SSL.ssl_subject_common_name | `drop_dm_object_name(All_Certificates)` | `drop_dm_object_name(SSL)`"
      }
    },
    "ds_ssl_cloud_sessions": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "SSL Cloud Sessions",
      "options": {
        "query": "| tstats `summariesonly` count from datamodel=Certificates.All_Certificates where nodename=All_Certificates.SSL `cloud_domain_search(\"All_Certificates.SSL.ssl_subject_common_name\")` by All_Certificates.SSL.ssl_subject_common_name,All_Certificates.src | `drop_dm_object_name(All_Certificates)` | `drop_dm_object_name(SSL)` | chart first(count) as count over src by ssl_subject_common_name | addtotals fieldname=total | sort 10 - total | fields - total"
      }
    },
    "ds_recent_ssl_sessions_table": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Recent SSL Sessions",
      "options": {
        "query": "| datamodel Certificates SSL search | head 50 | `drop_dm_object_name(All_Certificates)` | `drop_dm_object_name(SSL)` | eval ssl_expires_in=ssl_end_time-_time | eval _expiry=case(ssl_end_time<_time, \"expired\", ssl_expires_in<(86400*30), \"soon\", ssl_end_time>=_time, \"extended\", 1=1,\"unknown\") | eval ssl_end_time=strftime(ssl_end_time,\"%b %d %H:%M:%S %Y %Z\").case(ssl_end_time<_time, \" (expired)\", ssl_expires_in<(86400*30), \" (expires soon)\",1=1,\"\") | `uitime(ssl_start_time)` | eval ssl_is_valid=case(ssl_is_valid == \"0\", \"Invalid\", ssl_is_valid == \"true\", \"Invalid\", ssl_is_valid == true, \"Invalid\", ssl_is_valid == \"1\", \"Valid\", ssl_is_valid == \"true\", \"Valid\", ssl_is_valid == true, \"Valid\", 1=1,\"Unknown\") | eval formatter=tostring(ceil(ssl_validity_window), \"duration\") | eval days = ssl_validity_window /86400 | eval _day = case(days<30, \"(< 30 days)\", days<90, \"(< 90 days)\", days>90, \"day\", 1=1, \"\") | eval validity_in_days=ssl_validity_window/86400 | eval validity_in_hours=ssl_validity_window/3600 | eval validity_in_minutes=ssl_validity_window/60 | eval ssl_validity_window=case(validity_in_days>=1, replace(formatter,\"(\\d*)\\+(\\d+):(\\d+):(\\d+)\",\"\\1 days\"), validity_in_hours>=1, replace(formatter,\"[0]?(\\d{1,2}):[0]?(\\d{1,2}):[0]?(\\d{1,2})\",\"\\1 hours\"), validity_in_minutes>=1, replace(formatter,\"[0]?(\\d{1,2}):[0]?(\\d{1,2}):[0]?(\\d{1,2})\",\"\\2 minutes\"), 1=1, replace(formatter,\"[0]?(\\d{1,2}):[0]?(\\d{1,2}):[0]?(\\d{1,2})\",\"\\3 seconds\")).case(days<30, \" (< 30 days)\", days<90, \" (< 90 days)\", days>90, \"\", 1=1, \"\") | fillnull value=Unknown ssl_validity_window ssl_end_time | table src, dest, ssl_subject_common_name, ssl_subject_email, ssl_issuer_common_name, ssl_issuer_organization, ssl_start_time, ssl_end_time, ssl_validity_window, ssl_is_valid, _expiry, _day"
      }
    }
  },
  "defaults": {
    "visualizations": {
      "global": {
        "showProgressBar": true
      }
    },
    "dataSources": {
      "ds.search": {
        "options": {
          "queryParameters": {
            "latest": "$global_time.latest$",
            "earliest": "$global_time.earliest$"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "inputs": {
    "input_global_time": {
      "type": "input.timerange",
      "title": "Time Range",
      "options": {
        "token": "global_time",
        "defaultValue": "-24h@h,now"
      }
    }
  },
  "layout": {
    "type": "grid",
    "options": {},
    "structure": [{
      "item": "viz_keyIndicators",
      "type": "block",
      "position": {
        "x": 0,
        "y": 0,
        "w": 1200,
        "h": 150
      }
    },{
      "item": "viz_ssl_activity_by_common_name",
      "type": "block",
      "position": {
        "x": 0,
        "y": 150,
        "w": 600,
        "h": 250
      }
    },{
      "item": "viz_ssl_cloud_sessions",
      "type": "block",
      "position": {
        "x": 600,
        "y": 150,
        "w": 600,
        "h": 250
      }
    },{
      "item": "viz_recent_ssl_sessions_table",
      "type": "block",
      "position": {
        "x": 0,
        "y": 400,
        "w": 1200,
        "h": 300
      }
    }],
    "globalInputs": [
      "input_global_time"
    ]
  },
  "description": "",
  "title": "SSL Activity"
}]]></definition>
<meta><![CDATA[{
  "isEditable":true
}]]></meta>
</dashboard>

            "type": "ds.search",
            "options": {
                "query": "| tstats `summariesonly` max(_time) as _time,values(All_Certificates.SSL.ssl_subject) as ssl_subject,values(All_Certificates.SSL.ssl_issuer) as ssl_issuer,values(All_Certificates.SSL.ssl_hash) as ssl_hash,count from datamodel=Certificates.All_Certificates where nodename=All_Certificates.SSL $ds_input_tokens:result.src_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.dest_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.subject_issuer_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.cn_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.ssl_serial_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.ssl_hash_dm$ by All_Certificates.src,All_Certificates.dest,All_Certificates.SSL.ssl_serial | `drop_dm_object_name(All_Certificates)` | `drop_dm_object_name(SSL)` | sort - count | fields  _time, src, dest, ssl_subject, ssl_issuer, ssl_serial, ssl_hash, count"
            }
        },
        "ds_ssl_search_events": {
            "type": "ds.search",
            "options": {
                "query": "| from datamodel:\"Certificates\".\"SSL\" | search $ds_input_tokens:result.src_raw$ $ds_input_tokens:result.dest_raw$ $ds_input_tokens:result.subject_issuer_raw$ $ds_input_tokens:result.cn_raw$ $ds_input_tokens:result.ssl_serial_raw$ $ds_input_tokens:result.ssl_hash_raw$ | head 100"
            }
        },
        "ds_ssl_search_events_fieldsummary": {
            "type": "ds.chain",
            "name": "SSL Search events fieldsummary",
            "options": {
                "query": "fieldsummary maxvals=10",
                "extend": "ds_ssl_search_events"
            }
        },
        "ds_input_tokens": {
            "type": "ds.search",
            "name": "ds_input_tokens",
            "options": {
                "query": "| makeresults count=1\n| eval src_raw=if($src|s$==\"*\" OR $src|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(src=\\\"$src$\\\")\")\n| eval src_dm=if($src|s$==\"*\" OR $src|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(All_Certificates.src=\\\"$src$\\\")\")\n| eval dest_raw=if($dest|s$==\"*\" OR $dest|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(dest=\\\"$dest$\\\")\")\n| eval dest_dm=if($dest|s$==\"*\" OR $dest|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(All_Certificates.dest=\\\"$dest$\\\")\")\n| eval subject_issuer_raw=if($subject_issuer|s$==\"*\" OR $subject_issuer|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(ssl_subject=\\\"$subject_issuer$\\\" OR ssl_issuer=\\\"$subject_issuer$\\\")\")\n| eval subject_issuer_dm=if($subject_issuer|s$==\"*\" OR $subject_issuer|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(All_Certificates.SSL.ssl_subject=\\\"$subject_issuer$\\\" OR All_Certificates.SSL.ssl_issuer=\\\"$subject_issuer$\\\")\")\n| eval cn_raw=if($cn|s$==\"*\" OR $cn|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(ssl_subject_common_name=\\\"$cn$\\\" OR ssl_issuer_common_name=\\\"$cn$\\\")\")\n| eval cn_dm=if($cn|s$==\"*\" OR $cn|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(All_Certificates.SSL.ssl_subject_common_name=\\\"$cn$\\\" OR All_Certificates.SSL.ssl_issuer_common_name=\\\"$cn$\\\")\")\n| eval ssl_serial_raw=if($ssl_serial|s$==\"*\" OR $ssl_serial|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(ssl_serial=\\\"$ssl_serial$\\\")\")\n| eval ssl_serial_dm=if($ssl_serial|s$==\"*\" OR $ssl_serial|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(All_Certificates.SSL.ssl_serial=\\\"$ssl_serial$\\\")\")\n| eval ssl_hash_raw=if($ssl_hash|s$==\"*\" OR $ssl_hash|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(ssl_hash=\\\"$ssl_hash$\\\")\")\n| eval ssl_hash_dm=if($ssl_hash|s$==\"*\" OR $ssl_hash|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(All_Certificates.SSL.ssl_hash=\\\"$ssl_hash$\\\")\")\n| appendcols [|rest splunk_server=local count=0 /servicesNS/nobody/SplunkEnterpriseSecuritySuite/admin/macros/autopause | fields definition]\n| eval auto_pause=if(definition>0, definition, 0)",
                "enableSmartSources": true,
                "queryParameters": {
                    "earliest": "0",
                    "latest": "now"
                }
            }
        }
    },
    "defaults": {
        "visualizations": {
            "global": {
                "showProgressBar": true
            }
        },
        "dataSources": {
            "ds.search": {
                "options": {
                    "queryParameters": {
                        "latest": "$global_time.latest$",
                        "earliest": "$global_time.earliest$"
                    }
                }
            }
        },
        "ds.chain": {
            "options": {
                "queryParameters": {
                    "latest": "$global_time.latest$",
                    "earliest": "$global_time.earliest$"
                }
            }
        }
    },
    "inputs": {
      "input_src": {
        "type": "input.text",
        "title": "Source",
        "options": {
          "token": "src",
          "defaultValue": "*"
        }
      },
      "input_dest": {
        "type": "input.text",
        "title": "Destination",
        "options": {
          "token": "dest",
          "defaultValue": "*"
        }
      },
      "input_subject_issuer": {
        "type": "input.text",
        "title": "Subject/Issuer",
        "options": {
          "token": "subject_issuer",
          "defaultValue": "*"
        }
      },
      "input_cn": {
        "type": "input.text",
        "title": "Subject/Issuer Common Name",
        "options": {
          "token": "cn",
          "defaultValue": "*"
        }
      },
      "input_ssl_serial": {
        "type": "input.text",
        "title": "Certificate Serial Number",
        "options": {
          "token": "ssl_serial",
          "defaultValue": "*"
        }
      },
      "input_ssl_hash": {
        "type": "input.text",
        "title": "Certificate Hash",
        "options": {
          "token": "ssl_hash",
          "defaultValue": "*"
        }
      },
      "input_global_time": {
        "type": "input.timerange",
        "title": "Time Range",
        "options": {
          "token": "global_time",
          "defaultValue": "-24h@h,now"
        }
      }
    },
    "layout": {
      "type": "grid",
      "structure": [
        {
          "item": "viz_ssl_search_table",
          "type": "block",
          "position": {
            "x": 0,
            "y": 0,
            "w": 1200,
            "h": 270
          }
        },
        {
          "item": "viz_ssl_search_events",
          "type": "block",
          "position": {
            "x": 0,
            "y": 270,
            "w": 1200,
            "h": 400
          }
        }
      ],
      "globalInputs": [
        "input_src",
        "input_dest",
        "input_subject_issuer",
        "input_cn",
        "input_ssl_serial",
        "input_ssl_hash",
        "input_global_time"
      ]
    },
    "description": "",
    "title": "SSL Search"
}]]></definition>
<meta><![CDATA[{
  "isEditable":true
}]]></meta>
</dashboard>

result.label: Secure Gateway Subscription Inspector
result.title: subscription_search_inspector
result.description: This dashboard is intended to help troubleshoot issues with search processing logic within Splunk Secure Gateway. To get started click on one of the subscription iterations.
result.eai:data:
This dashboard is intended to help troubleshoot issues with search processing logic within Splunk Secure Gateway. To get started click on one of the subscription iterations.
-15m now
Subscription Iterations index=_internal source=*secure* request_id=subscription-iteration* | rex "subscription-iteration-(?<iteration>[0-9]+) " | eval iteration=strftime(iteration, "%Y-%m-%dT %H:%M:%S.%Z") | stats count by request_id, iteration | sort -_time | reverse $time.earliest$ $time.latest$ 30s delay iteration $row.request_id$
Current Active Searches Being Processed by SSG Click On A Search To See Dispatch Status Of Search Job index=_internal source=*secure* request_id=$request_id$ Processing pubsub subscription | rex "query=(?<query>[^\,]+)\," | eval last_updated=strftime(last_updated, "%Y-%m-%dT %H:%M:%S.%Z") | eval next_update=strftime(next_update, "%Y-%m-%dT %H:%M:%S.%Z") | table dashboard_id, query, subscribers, search_id, base, owner,input_tokens, last_updated, next_update, sid, search_key $time.earliest$ $time.latest$ dashboard_id, query, subscribers, base, search_id, owner,input_tokens, last_updated, next_update $row.sid$
Search Dispatch Status |rest services/search/jobs/$sid$ | table author, dispatchState, runDuration, doneProgress, isDone, eventCount, diskUsage, earliestTime, latestTime, sid $time.earliest$ $time.latest$

result.label: Subscription Tracing
result.title: subscription_tracing_dashboard
result.description: Use this dashboard to troubleshoot a panel that isn’t loading. Select a time range and a panel ID to get troubleshooting logs and a stack trace.
result.eai:data:
mobile,tv Use this dashboard to troubleshoot a panel that isn’t loading. Select a time range and a panel ID to get troubleshooting logs and a stack trace. index=_internal sourcetype=secure_gateway_app_internal_log ("[create_subscription]" "Subscription created.") OR "Finished process_unsubscribe_request" | fields subscription_id, search_key, request_id, device_id, current_user, type, log_level, count, time_taken, update_id $field1.earliest$ $field1.latest$ | search "[create_subscription]" "Subscription created." index=_internal sourcetype=secure_gateway_app_internal_log subscription_id=$subscriptionId$ index=_internal sourcetype=secure_gateway_app_internal_log send_subscription_updates subscription_id=$subscriptionId$ | transaction update_id startswith="Sending subscription update" endswith="Subscription Update Sent" | eval latency = duration | fields _time, update_id, type, latency | search "Finished process_unsubscribe_request" | fields count
-15m now $subscriptionId$
All Subscriptions | table _time, subscription_id, search_key, request_id, device_id, current_user $row.subscription_id$
Subscription Errors for $subscriptionId$ |search log_level=ERROR | stats count as error_count | eval errors = if(error_count > 0, "YES", "NONE") | eval range=if(error_count > 0, "severe", "low") | table errors, range /app/search/search?q=search index=_internal sourcetype=secure_gateway_app_internal_log subscription_id=$subscriptionId$ log_level=ERROR Type | table type Current User | table current_user Device ID | eval device = substr(device_id, 0, 6) | table device Total Updates | stats count | table count Average Update Latency | stats avg(latency) as avg_latency by update_id | table avg_latency Currently Subscribed | stats count as count | eval ok = if(count > 0, "NO", "YES") | eval range=if(count > 0, "severe", "low") | table ok, range Updates: $subscriptionId$ | table _time, update_id, type, latency
Raw Events: $subscriptionId$

      "name": "Operating Systems",
      "options": {
        "query": "| from inputlookup:system_version_tracker | `get_asset(dest)` | `get_identity4events(dest_owner)` | search $ds_input_tokens:result.dest_raw$ $ds_input_tokens:result.bunit_raw$ $ds_input_tokens:result.category_raw$ | stats count by os"
      }
    },
    "ds_top_average_cpu_load_by_system": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Top-Average CPU Load By System",
      "options": {
        "query": "| `tstats` avg(All_Performance.CPU.cpu_load_percent) from datamodel=Performance.All_Performance where nodename=All_Performance.CPU [| `tstats` avg(All_Performance.CPU.cpu_load_percent) from datamodel=Performance.All_Performance where nodename=All_Performance.CPU $ds_input_tokens:result.dest_perf_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.bunit_perf_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.category_perf_dm$ by All_Performance.dest | stats avg(All_Performance.CPU.cpu_load_percent) as \"avg\" by All_Performance.dest | sort 10 - \"avg\" | fields All_Performance.dest | format] by _time,All_Performance.dest span=10m | timechart minspan=10m avg(All_Performance.CPU.cpu_load_percent) as \"avg_cpu_load(%)\" by All_Performance.dest | `drop_dm_object_name(\"All_Performance\")`"
      }
    },
    "ds_services_by_system_count": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Services By System Count",
      "options": {
        "query": "| tstats `summariesonly` dc(Services.dest) as dest_count from datamodel=Endpoint.Services where * $ds_input_tokens:result.dest_services_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.bunit_services_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.category_services_dm$ by Services.service | `drop_dm_object_name(\"Services\")` | sort 100 - dest_count"
      }
    },
    "ds_ports_by_system_count": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "Ports By System Count",
      "options": {
        "query": "| tstats `summariesonly` dc(Ports.dest) as dest_count from datamodel=Endpoint.Ports where * $ds_input_tokens:result.dest_ports_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.bunit_ports_dm$ $ds_input_tokens:result.category_ports_dm$ by Ports.transport,Ports.dest_port | `drop_dm_object_name(\"Ports\")` | sort 100 - dest_count"
      }
    },
    "ds_input_tokens": {
      "type": "ds.search",
      "name": "ds_input_tokens",
      "options": {
        "enableSmartSources": true,
        "query": "| makeresults count=1\n| eval dest_raw=if($dest_form|s$==\"*\" OR $dest_form|s$==\"\", \" \", \"dest=\\\"$dest_form$\\\"\")\n| eval dest_perf_dm=if($dest_form|s$==\"*\" OR $dest_form|s$==\"\", \" \", \"All_Performance.dest=\\\"$dest_form$\\\"\")\n| eval dest_ports_dm=if($dest_form|s$==\"*\" OR $dest_form|s$==\"\", \" \", \"Ports.dest=\\\"$dest_form$\\\"\")\n| eval dest_services_dm=if($dest_form|s$==\"*\" OR $dest_form|s$==\"\", \" \", \"Services.dest=\\\"$dest_form$\\\"\")\n| eval bunit_raw=if($bunit|s$==\"*\" OR $bunit|s$==\"\", \" \", \"dest_bunit=\\\"$bunit$\\\"\")\n| eval bunit_perf_dm=if($bunit|s$==\"*\" OR $bunit|s$==\"\", \" \", \"All_Performance.dest_bunit=\\\"$bunit$\\\"\")\n| eval bunit_ports_dm=if($bunit|s$==\"*\" OR $bunit|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(Ports.dest_bunit=\\\"$bunit$\\\" OR Ports.user_bunit=\\\"$bunit$\\\")\")\n| eval bunit_services_dm=if($bunit|s$==\"*\" OR $bunit|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(Services.dest_bunit=\\\"$bunit$\\\" OR Services.user_bunit=\\\"$bunit$\\\")\")\n| eval category_raw=if($category|s$==\"*\" OR $category|s$==\"\", \" \", \"dest_category=\\\"$category$\\\"\")\n| eval category_perf_dm=if($category|s$==\"*\" OR $category|s$==\"\", \" \", \"All_Performance.dest_category=\\\"$category$\\\"\")\n| eval category_ports_dm=if($category|s$==\"*\" OR $category|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(Ports.dest_category=\\\"$category$\\\" OR Ports.user_category=\\\"$category$\\\")\")\n| eval category_services_dm=if($category|s$==\"*\" OR $category|s$==\"\", \" \", \"(Services.dest_category=\\\"$category$\\\" OR Services.user_category=\\\"$category$\\\")\")\n| appendcols [|rest splunk_server=local count=0 /servicesNS/nobody/SplunkEnterpriseSecuritySuite/admin/macros/autopause | fields definition]\n| eval auto_pause=if(definition>0, definition, 0)",
        "queryParameters": {
            "earliest": "0",
            "latest": "now"
        }
     }
    }
  },
  "defaults": {
    "visualizations": {
      "global": {
        "showProgressBar": true
      }
    },
    "dataSources": {
      "ds.search": {
        "options": {
          "queryParameters": {
            "latest": "$global_time.latest$",
            "earliest": "$global_time.earliest$"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "inputs": {
    "input_dest_form": {
      "type": "input.text",
      "title": "Destination",
      "options": {
        "token": "dest_form",
        "defaultValue": "*"
      }
    },
    "input_bunit": {
      "type": "input.text",
      "title": "Business Unit",
      "options": {
        "token": "bunit",
        "defaultValue": "*"
      }
    },
    "input_category": {
      "type": "input.dropdown",
      "title": "Category",
      "options": {
        "token": "category",
        "defaultValue": "*",
        "items": [{
          "value": "*",
          "label": "All"
        }]
      },
      "encoding": {
        "value": "primary.category",
        "label": "primary.category"
      },
      "dataSources": {
        "primary": "ds_category"
      }
    },
    "input_global_time": {
      "type": "input.timerange",
      "title": "Time Range",
      "options": {
        "token": "global_time",
        "defaultValue": "-24h@h,now"
      }
    }
  },
  "layout": {
    "type": "grid",
    "options": {},
    "structure": [{
      "item": "viz_operating_systems",
      "type": "block",
      "position": {
        "x": 0,
        "y": 0,
        "w": 600,
        "h": 250
      }
    },{
      "item": "viz_top_average_cpu_load_by_system",
      "type": "block",
      "position": {
        "x": 600,
        "y": 0,
        "w": 600,
        "h": 250
      }
    },{
      "item": "viz_services_by_system_count",
      "type": "block",
      "position": {
        "x": 0,
        "y": 250,
        "w": 600,
        "h": 250
      }
    },{
      "item": "viz_ports_by_system_count",
      "type": "block",
      "position": {
        "x": 600,
        "y": 250,
        "w": 600,
        "h": 250
      }
    }],
    "globalInputs": [
      "input_dest_form",
      "input_bunit",
      "input_category",
      "input_global_time"
    ]
  },
  "description": "",
  "title": "System Center"
}]]></definition>
<meta><![CDATA[{
  "isEditable":true
}]]></meta>
</dashboard>

result.label: Single Value Test
result.title: test_dashboard_single_value
result.description: This single-value panel is a test to check if a simple dashboard loads in Splunk Secure Gateway. It helps identify possible causes for issues during troubleshooting.
result.eai:data:
<dashboard hideEdit="True" version="1.1" theme="dark">
  <tags>mobile,tv</tags>
  <label>Single Value Test</label>
  <description>This single-value panel is a test to check if a simple dashboard loads in Splunk Secure Gateway. It helps identify possible causes for issues during troubleshooting.</description>
  <row>
    <panel>
      <title>Single Value</title>
      <single>
        <title>Single Value</title>
        <search>
          <query>| makeresults | eval testValue=random() | table testValue</query>
          <refresh>15s</refresh>
        </search>
        <option name="drilldown">none</option>
      </single>
    </panel>
  </row>
</dashboard>

result.label: threat_activity_data
